answers.answer: im in the same boat , i have a PCOS , prolactinoma and also TTC for last few months , just like you i also been pregnant before and it was very easy . actually i havent been trying it properly but comparing to my previous pregnancies it surprised me not conceiving  after few months , but still havent seen doctors just yet. because i wasnt using my medicines last few months had a very irregular periods , it was kind of hard to track the ovulation .  i will start them again who knows maybe this time i need to be on them to conceive .  also , if you have a irregular periods , metformin helped me alot with them , i was having 28 days cycles with it , i ve heard it works very well with  clomid you can give it a try .

for prolactine i use , cabergoline . and do you know if you get checked for insulin levels , because there are few other things whihc may help with the fertility , like if you have hihg insulin and overweight even losing few kilos may boost your fertility ,  if he thinks you can not get pregnant because of your high prolactine levels i dont think you need 6-8 months . it can be much sooner because i know when i use my medicines regularly my prolactine levels drop fast . you didnt list folic acid you should use is aswell if you arent already . not to boost fertility but its good to take if you are trying to get pregnant to prevent some birth defects . good luck !

I too have been TTC with PCOS, Prolactinoma, Endometriosis, Hashimotos and Diabetes.  All are being treated but have been trying for 10 months with no luck yet.I took take Cabergoline (Dostinex) for prolactinoma.
